page.title: 01STROOD AND ROCHESTER
page.content:
Strood is on the edge of the Medway Towns, separated by the River Medway and Rochester Bridge from historic Rochester.
Industry in Strood is declining with the recession and in 1985 there are many either unemployed or commuting to London for work.
Rochester has been developed into a tourist attraction. During the summer many people can be seen walking the attractively paved High Street visiting such places as the Charles Dickens Centre, the Castle and the Cathedral.
With the closing of Chatham Dockyard the river has lost some of its importance but trade and industry still still use it along with sailing boats and pleasure craft. By Julie Harris
